expl: he had a number of chores to do
the number of parameters is small
the figure was about a thousand
number.n.01.defn: the property possessed by a sum or total or indefinite quantity of units or individuals

expl: every number has a unique position in the sequence
number.n.02.defn: a concept of quantity involving zero and units

expl: he did his act three times every evening
she had a catchy little routine
it was one of the best numbers he ever did
act.n.04.defn: a short theatrical performance that is part of a longer program

expl: he has an unlisted number
phone_number.n.01.defn: the number is used in calling a particular telephone

expl: he learned to write the numerals before he went to school
numeral.n.01.defn: a symbol used to represent a number

expl: she found an old issue of the magazine in her dentist's waiting room
issue.n.02.defn: one of a series published periodically

expl: I hope to become one of their number before I die
she refused to give them her Social Security number
number.n.08.defn: a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification

expl: a number 13 shoe
in English the subject and the verb must agree in number
number.n.10.defn: the grammatical category for the forms of nouns and pronouns and verbs that are used depending on the number of entities involved (singular or dual or plural)

expl: she preferred the black nylon number
this sweater is an all-wool number
number.n.11.defn: an item of merchandise offered for sale

expl: the light was filtered through a soft glass window
light.n.01.defn: (physics) electromagnetic radiation that can produce a visual sensation

expl: he stopped the car and turned off the lights
light.n.02.defn: any device serving as a source of illumination

expl: although he saw it in a different light, he still did not understand
light.n.03.defn: a particular perspective or aspect of a situation

expl: its luminosity is measured relative to that of our sun
luminosity.n.01.defn: the quality of being luminous; emitting or reflecting light

expl: he stepped into the light
follow God's light
light.n.06.defn: a condition of spiritual awareness; divine illumination

expl: he could paint the lightest light and the darkest dark
light.n.07.defn: the visual effect of illumination on objects or scenes as created in pictures

expl: the light of my life
they played as long as it was light
as long as the lighting was good
he finally saw the light
can you shed light on this problem?
light.n.10.defn: mental understanding as an enlightening experience

expl: he had a sparkle in his eye
there's a perpetual twinkle in his eyes
sparkle.n.01.defn: merriment expressed by a brightness or gleam or animation of countenance

expl: it brought the scandal to light

inner_light.n.01.defn: a divine presence believed by Quakers to enlighten and guide the soul

expl: they saw the light of the beacon
there was a light at every corner
do you have a light?
lighter.n.02.defn: a device for lighting or igniting fuel or charges or fires
